intro: Leptohyptis leptostachys subsp. leptostachys, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hyptis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves with a distinctive serrated margin. Its flowers are typically clustered in dense inflorescences and are usually white or pale purple in color. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks.
